referringproviderid.description: The referring provider ID for this claim. See /referringproviders. This is not the same as the ID from the /providers call.

note.description: The note that is attached to this status.

status.description: The status associated with this responsible payer.

note.description: The note that is attached to this status.

status.description: The status associated with this responsible payer.

diagnosisid.description: A unique ID related to this diagnosis.

diagnosisrawcode.description: The raw ICD-9 code. This will migrate to ICD-10 in the future.

deleteddiagnosis.description: In certain cases, diagnoses may be added and then removed from a particular claim. In normal circumstances, this will be false. However, if a diagnosis was removed, this will be true.

claimcreateddate.description: The date the claim was created.

procedures.description: Procedures is an array of all procedures. /ccda is a better clinical representation. These fields are:

procedurecategory.description: The category name associated with this procedure.

allowablemin.description: The minimum amount expected from payer for all services from this procedure.

chargeamount.description: The amount charged for this procedure.

transactionid.description: The ID of the last transaction associated with the claim.

procedurecode.description: The CPT code associated with this procedure.

allowablemax.description: The maximum amount expected from payer for all services from this procedure.

allowableamount.description: The total amount expected from payer for all services from this procedure.

billedproviderid.description: The provider ID of the billing provider for this claim.

appointmentid.description: The appointment ID associated with this claim.

chargeamount.description: The total amount billed for all services from this claim.

transactionid.description: A unique ID for the primary transaction this claim represents. May be useful for debugging.

claimid.description: athenaNet's internal ID for this claim, specific to the practice.
